revised_title: The Role of the Klebs-Loffler Bacillus in Diphtheria and Its Connection to a Mysterious Cat Disease
tldr: The author investigates the etiology of diphtheria and discovers that two species of bacilli, Klebs-Loffler bacillus No. 1 and No. 2, are present in diphtheritic membranes. The author also finds a connection between a mysterious cat disease and human diphtheria, suggesting that the lung is the organ in which the diphtheritic process in cats has its seat.
